page.title: 15BROADWATER NURSERY
page.content: Mr Wilks has owned this LOCAL INDUSTRY for the last 5 yrs, but only uses half the 12.5 acres, as a sitting tenant is on the other half. Originally the area was a watercress bed connected to the River Gade and the soil contains fertile silt. Mr Wilks was attracted by the countryside and nearby lake. Of the 11 EMPLOYEES at the centre most have been trained at High Wycombe and those who work with the plants have all been to Agricultural College. Customers come from a 20 mile radius to buy the PLANTS and SHRUBS, half of which were originally grown at the nursery but are now bought from other centres or imported from Europe. Plants and shrubs are sold on a seasonal basis. 2 years ago the main building was extended and planning permission granted to develop the lake
